task_summary: The robot arm pours liquid from a cup into a mug, starting from an aligned pre-position, executing the pour over the mug, and retreating after completion.

task_long_description.overview: This episode features a 6-DOF robot arm performing a pouring task. The arm first locates and approaches the mug on the workspace, aligns the cup above the mug, and performs a controlled pour, tilting the source cup until its contents are transferred into the mug. After pouring, the arm retreats to a safe position. The core objects are the cup (source) and mug (target). The process relies on successful visual detection, alignment, and pour actuation; timing and force are set for a typical controlled pour. No container opening is necessary, and obstacles are absent.
preconditions: Cup is grasped and contains pourable material
Mug is upright and visible on the table
Workspace clear of obstacles above mug
stepwise_plan: Move cup to position above mug
Perform pouring action with prescribed tilt and rate
Retreat arm to avoid spillage or collision
failure_and_recovery: Mug not detected: retry visual scan
Collision detected: retreat and replan approach
task_long_description.termination: Task terminates when pour is complete and the robot has retreated to a safe distance from the mug.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the mug is visible in the robot's workspace.
Detects and localizes the mug; if not already visible, initiates a scan.
Moves the robot's end effector with cup above the mug with 10 cm offset.
Pours full contents from the cup into the mug with a 90 degree tilt at normal rate.
Retracts the robot arm by 10 cm after pouring is complete.

failure_modes: Robot fails to retreat after pouring
recovery_strategy: Fallback scan for mug if not seen
Retry pour if contents remain in cup
Retreat and replan if collision detected
assumptions: Frame analysis shows cup already graspedâ€”no explicit grasp step
Instruction does not specify source; frames indicate pouring from cup
Pour appears to be of complete contents, thus amount='full'
No requirement for tight force or time tolerance per instruction or frames
No container opening needed per episode frames

expected_success_criteria: Cup contents transferred into mug without spill
Pour performed while mug is visible and correctly positioned
